  • All Classes
 

All Classes

  • All Classes Interface Summary Class Summary Enum Summary Exception Summary Annotation Types Summary 
    Class Description
    ACDP
    Provides some methods that are needed only in special situations.
    ACDPException
    The super class of all other exception types in this package.
    ArrayOfRefType
    The array column type with elements being references.
    ArrayType
    The array column type with elements of SimpleType.
    BooleanType
    The column type analogon of a Java boolean or Boolean type.
    ByteType
    The column type analogon of a Java byte or Byte type.
    CL
    Provides factory methods that return columns of various types.
    Column<T>
    The column of a table.
    ColVal<T>
    Defines a column value pair.
    ConsistencyException
    Thrown if the value of the consistency number given at the time a strongly typed database is opened differs from the value of the consistency number stored in the database layout.
    CreationException
    Thrown to indicate that an object can't be created due to any reason.
    CryptoException
    Thrown if there is a problem with data encryption or decryption.
    CustomDatabase
    Defines the super class of a custom database class.
    CustomTable
    Defines the super class of a custom table class.
    DanglingCommentException
    Thrown to indicate that a manually added comment in a layout read from a file or a stream is not properly followed or not followed at all by an entry or an element of a sequence.
    Database
    Defines the database and provides the Database.open(java.nio.file.Path, int, boolean, acdp.design.ICipherFactory) method.
    DeleteConstraintException
    Thrown if the user tries to delete a row with a reference count greater than zero which means that the row is referenced by this or some other row.
    DoubleType
    The column type analogon of a Java double or Double type.
    FloatType
    The column type analogon of a Java float or Float type.
    ICipherFactory
    Declares methods used to encrypt and decrypt data in a database.
    IllegalReferenceException
    Thrown if a row reference is illegal.
    ImplementationRestrictionException
    Thrown if an exception due to an implementation restricition has occurred.
    IndentationException
    Thrown to indicate that the lines of text in a layout read from a file or a stream are not properly indented.
    Information
    Groups the info interfaces on the level of the database, table, column and store, respectively.
    Information.ColumnInfo
    The column info comprises some useful information about a column, including all values from the column sublayout.
    Information.DatabaseInfo
    The database info comprises some useful information about the database, including all values from the database layout.
    Information.DatabaseInfo.DBType
    The type of a database.
    Information.ROStoreInfo
    The RO store info comprises some useful information about the RO store of a table of an RO database, including all values from the store sublayout.
    Information.StoreInfo
    The super interface of the Information.WRStoreInfo and Information.ROStoreInfo interfaces.
    Information.TableInfo
    The table info comprises some useful information about a table, including all values from the table layout.
    Information.WRStoreInfo
    The WR store info comprises some useful information about the WR store of a table of a WR database, including all values from the store sublayout.
    IntegerType
    The column type analogon of a Java int or Integer type.
    IOFailureException
    Thrown to indicate that an I/O error has occurred.
    KeyFigures
    Writes to the standard output stream a few key figures of the stores of the tables of a WR database.
    Layout
    Defines a layout, that is, a collection of well-structured values.
    Layout.LtEntry
    A layout entry.
    Layout.Seq
    Defines the sequence value type of a layout.
    LongType
    The column type analogon of a Java long or Long type.
    MaximumException
    Thrown if one of the maximum values specified in the nobsRowRef, nobsOutrowPtr and nobsRefCount fields of the table layout is violated.
    MissingEntryException
    Thrown to indicate that a layout is missing a requested entry.
    ReadZone
    Confines a sequence of read-only operations protected against the effects of concurrent write operations.
    Ref
    Defines a reference to a row in a table.
    Refactor
    Provides methods for changing the structure of a WR database as well as methods for changing some fundamental table parameters which involve the modification of the internal format of one or more backing files.
    Refactor.Names
    Declares methods for fluently creating a list where each element is equal to a column name and, provided that the column references a table, the name of the referenced table.
    RefType
    The reference column type.
    Row
    Defines a data structure housing some or all values stored in a particular row of a Table.
    Settings
    Lets you view all settings of a WR database and enables you to safely modify some of them.
    Setup
    Assists with setting up a database once the concrete custom database class, the concrete custom table classes and the optional custom column types have been coded.
    Setup.SetupColumn
    The @SetupColumn annotation is used by the Setup Tool to identify the column objects declared within a table class.
    Setup.SetupDatabase
    The @SetupDatabase annotation is used by the Setup Tool to get the name of the database and the names of the database's tables.
    Setup.SetupTable
    The @SetupTable annotation is used by the Setup Tool to get the names of the table's columns.
    Setup.SetupTableDeclaration
    The @SetupTableDeclaration annotation is used by the Setup Tool to identify a table declaration within the database class.
    ShortType
    The column type analogon of a Java short or Short type.
    ShutdownException
    Thrown if the database is still used after it was closed.
    SimpleType<T>
    The super class of all non-array custom and built-in column types with the exception of the built-in reference column type.
    SimpleType.TypeDesc
    Provides convenient access to the individual fields of a type descriptor that is represented by a String.
    SimpleType.TypeFromDesc
    A class method annotated with the TypeFromDesc annotation takes the String representation of a type descriptor and returns an instance of a subclass of SimpleType.
    ST
    Provides factory methods which return a built-in simple column type that can be used as second argument of the CL.ofArray(int, SimpleType) method.
    ST.Nulls
    Defines the constants used to indicate whether a column allows for the null value or not.
    ST.OutrowStringLength
    Defines the constants used to indicate the maximum number of characters of an outrow string.
    StringType
    The column type analogon of a Java String type.
    Table
    The table of a database.
    Table.TableIterator
    Defines an iterator over the rows of a given table.
    Table.ValueChanger<T>
    Provides a new value that depends on the stored value.
    Table.ValueSupplier<T>
    Provides a new value that does not depend on the stored value.
    Table.ValueSwitcher<T>
    Provides a new value that depends on the untyped stored value.
    Type
    Defines the super interface of all column types.
    Type.Scheme
    Defines the so called inrow and outrow storage schemes for values of a particular column type.
    Unit
    Confines an atomically executed sequence of read/write database operations that has to be committed or otherwise undone.
    UnitBrokenException
    Thrown to indicate that the unit is broken.
    Utils
    Defines some useful constants and methods that are heavily used inside ACDP but may be useful to custom database designers as well.
